climbs.name: Tarantula
climbs.fa: Jason Stevens and Jared Nielsen, 15 April 2006

content.description: Fire up the scorpion slab with excellent protection. Follows a series of small bulges on good quality rock. The starting moves are challenging, but well protected. Another short crux bulge comes near the top. This route terminates at a two bolt anchor with some slings on them. It wouldn't be difficult to continue up Scorpion Slab for more climbing fun
content.location: The far left side of the Scorpion Slab. Has slings with rap rings at the top.

content.description: A fantastic sport climb that has all kinds of exciting movement on it. Not so much slabby as crimpy with good quartzite friction. The first bolt is an easy clip but getting to the second is committing. Make sure your belayer is paying attention should you biff it. Follow the bolts up to a ledge and then duck a couple feet right past a couple more bolts to a chain anchor at the top of the formation.
content.protection: Quickdraws. Chain anchors at the top.
content.location: The right side of the Scorpion Slab. Comes extremely close to the route Scorpion Slab (5.8) in the middle of the route.

climbs.name: Scorpion Slab
climbs.fa: Ben Folsom and Maura Hahnenberger  Sept. 2007

content.description: The crux is getting off the ground, then climb up past eight? bolts to a two bolt & chain anchor on the summit of the formation.
content.protection: Quickdraws.  An optional but not needed smaller cam (3/4") can be used near the top.
content.location: If you park at the corral south of the main Ibex area, walk north under some crags and then west up the hill to the base of a nice looking, wall.  Approach takes about 5 minutes.  There are two routes on the slab, an easier 5.6? which is bolted to the left, and Scorpion Slab is on the right.

climbs.name: Satisfaction Guaranteed
climbs.fa: Tim Toula 2009 FFA: Peter Vintoniv, 6 April 2012

content.description:
Many amazing individual moves combine to bring satisfaction after working this puzzle out. Peter V expressed a bit of disappointment after solving the puzzle. Sometimes the process is more intriguing than the solution.

Both Tim and Peter rave about the unique movement. Tim originally thought it to be as hard as 5.13c! More consensus will be a better judge.
content.protection: QDs for 8 bolts. The bolts need chains added.
content.location: South facing around to the right of Melting Bits (5.10d). These two routes are on a separate buttress just east of Scorpion Slab and offer very steep routes.

content.description: Climb past 3 bolts to a two bolt anchor with chains.  Short but good.  The crux is getting to the anchor.
content.location: On the wall just right of Scorpion Slab.  The route faces Southwest.
